intro: Chamaesyce tamaulipasana, commonly known as the Tamaulipas sandmat, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Portulacaceae and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming structure. The plant features fleshy, succulent leaves that help it retain moisture in dry environments. Its flowers are small, yellowish-green, and typically appear in clusters during the warmer months. Chamaesyce tamaulipasana is adapted to thrive in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in desert scrub habitats.
